name: Libérte
overview: You are on your bunk in a hut, it's been home for the past 2 years. The time has come to escape and you've been working on a plan. Now is the time to put it into operation. Game by Paul Eves and released in multiple publications including Commodore Disk User 1989/05-06, Your Commodore 1990/10 (Tape #09), and Games Disk 6 (1991). Can you escape from the top security P.O.W camp that you find yourself in. Help the Resistance to destroy the Gestapo HQ and find your way home. Liberte employs the usual verb, noun input but you can use extend commands for effect. For example, you can say either 'Take gun' or Take the large machine gun'. he scene is a prisoner of war camp in France. Your job is to use cunning and stealth to break out of the camp. Once safely outside, however, your task is not over because, to succeed in your escape, you are required to join up with the Resistance and help them destroy the local Gestapo HQ All your powers of concealment wilt be required to complete your mission, for during the day and night, German patrols roam the countryside at random. Do not get picked up more than once you will not be able to carry out your escape if you are. (Hint). As in real life, it sometimes helps to be in the right place at the right time and it is always good to have a look around first. There is a save game option to be used.
